com.itko.lisa.coordinator

Class TestRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.itko.lisa.coordinator.TestRunner

  • public class TestRunner
extends java.lang.Object
    The TestRunner class provides a handy way to stage and run a test from the command line, or programmatically by executing methods from this class in Java.

    The method stageTest() is ideal if you are looking for a way to make one method call to stage a test onto the network.

    It is different from the runner in com.itko.lisa.coordinator.CoordinatorImpl in that it will stage the test via a networked CoordinatorServer. That means, this test will not necessarily be run locally.

    See Also:
    TestRegistry, CoordinatorServer

      • execSuite

        public static int execSuite(java.lang.String marFile,
            boolean autoStart)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Provides a single-method interface into execution of a test suite. This method delegates quite a bit to the StagedSuite class so look there for semantics.
        Parameters:
        marFile - the model archive containing the suite you wish to run
        autoStart - do you want a System.in-based prompt when the suite is ready to run?
        Returns:
        the number of failed tests, or 0 if none did
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.lang.Exception
        TestDefException

      • execSuite

        public static int execSuite(java.lang.String suiteFile,
            java.lang.String configFile,
            boolean autoStart)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Provides a single-method interface into execution of a test suite. This method delegates quite a bit to the StagedSuite class so look there for semantics.
        Parameters:
        suiteFile - the suite you wish to run
        configFile - the testRunnerContext to run for this suite, or null to use test default configs
        autoStart - do you want a System.in-based prompt when the suite is ready to run?
        Returns:
        the number of failed tests, or 0 if none did
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.lang.Exception
        TestDefException

      • stageTestByMAR

        public static TestCoordinator stageTestByMAR(Coordinator parent,
                             java.lang.String marFileLocation,
                             java.lang.String csName)
                                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                             TestDefException
        This as of 5.1 will become probably the most commonly used of the ways to stage tests with TestRunner; we take a reference to a mar file and we read it and stage it to a possibly remote Coordinator.
        Parameters:
        parent - [opt] the parent Coordinator of the one you want us to make (like a StagedSuite)
        marFileLocation - the relative, absolute, http, or classpath reference to a .mar file
        csName - [opt] the name of the specific coordinator server you want to serve this test
        Returns:
        a TestCoordinator that is ready for a startTest() call
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestDefException

      • stageTestByMAR

        public static TestCoordinator stageTestByMAR(Coordinator parent,
                             java.lang.String marFileLocation,
                             java.lang.String csName,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attrs)
                                      throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                             TestDefException
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestDefException

      • stageTest

        public static TestCoordinator stageTest(java.lang.String testRun,
                        java.lang.String testName,
                        java.lang.String configFile,
                        java.lang.String csName)
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                        TestDefException
        This method will stage a test with the given parameters onto the network and return the Coordinator that can be used to start, query, and stop the test. In one method, it does all the work of preparing the test for execution. The parameters shown below can be any file, URL, or CLASSPATH resource as supported by com.itko.lisa.util.XMLUtils.openXMLDoc()
        Parameters:
        testRun - - the Run document file spec
        testName - - the Test Case document file spec
        configFile - - named config in the test case OR the properties document file spec, or null if not used
        csName - - the name of the CoordinatorServer you want to stage this test upon. If you provide a null or empty name, the test is staged locally. If you don't provide a name but you did provide a tr, then we pick one randomly for you.
        Returns:
        a Coordinator that is ready to start the test. Your next step is to call Coordinator.startTest(), or use the method in this class runThisTest()
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestDefException - if their was an issue with the Run/TestCase/Registry documents
        See Also:
        XMLUtils.openXMLDoc(java.lang.String), Coordinator

        public static TestCoordinator stageTest(java.lang.String testRun,

      • stageTest

        public static TestCoordinator stageTest(Coordinator parent,
                        java.lang.String testRun,
                        java.lang.String testName,
                        java.lang.String configFile,
                        java.lang.String csName)
                                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                        TestDefException
        This method will stage a test with the given parameters onto the network and return the Coordinator that can be used to start, query, and stop the test. In one method, it does all the work of preparing the test for execution. The parameters shown below can be any file, URL, or CLASSPATH resource as supported by com.itko.lisa.util.XMLUtils.openXMLDoc()
        Parameters:
        parent - - the parent Coordinator -- not yet fully implemented
        testRun - - the Run document file spec
        testName - - the Test Case document file spec
        configFile - - named config in the test case OR the properties document file spec, or null if not used
        csName - - the name of the CoordinatorServer you want to stage this test upon. If you provide a null or empty name, the test is staged locally. If you don't provide a name but you did provide a tr, then we pick one randomly for you.
        Returns:
        a Coordinator that is ready to start the test. Your next step is to call Coordinator.startTest(), or use the method in this class runThisTest()
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestDefException - if their was an issue with the Run/TestCase/Registry documents
        Since:
        3.6 -- parent functionality not fully implemented
        See Also:
        XMLUtils.openXMLDoc(java.lang.String), Coordinator

      • runThisTest

        public static int runThisTest(Coordinator c,
              int updateSecs,
              java.io.PrintStream statusOut)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              TestRunException
        This method simplifies exeuting a test case and receiving stats output through the given stream. If the test executes normally, every updateSecs interval there will be a logging style output of the current TestRunInfo stats.
        Parameters:
        c - - the Coordinator that should run this test
        updateSecs - - how frequently you want stats output into the Stream (min of 1)
        statusOut - - the Stream object that should receive status output, or null
        Returns:
        the exit status for the test, which is modeled after command line invokation. Constants are in com.itko.lisa.test.Environment. 0 (Zero) means success, non-zero is some kind of error condition.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestRunException
        See Also:
        Coordinator, Environment

      • runThisTest

        public static int runThisTest(Coordinator c,
              int updateSecs,
              java.io.PrintStream statusOut,
              TestRunner.ExecutionMode mode)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              TestRunException
        This method simplifies exeuting a test case and receiving stats output through the given stream. If the test executes normally, every updateSecs interval there will be a logging style output of the current TestRunInfo stats.
        Parameters:
        c - - the Coordinator that should run this test
        updateSecs - - how frequently you want stats output into the Stream (min of 1)
        statusOut - - the Stream object that should receive status output, or null
        mode - - the type (standalone or embedded) of execution this test should run under
        Returns:
        the exit status for the test, which is modeled after command line invokation. Constants are in com.itko.lisa.test.Environment. 0 (Zero) means success, non-zero is some kind of error condition.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestRunException
        See Also:
        Coordinator, Environment

      • runThisTest

        public static int runThisTest(java.util.List<?> cList,
              Coordinator c,
              int updateSecs,
              java.io.PrintStream statusOut,
              TestRunner.ExecutionMode mode)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              TestRunException
        This method simplifies exeuting a test case and receiving stats output through the given stream. If the test executes normally, every updateSecs interval there will be a logging style output of the current TestRunInfo stats.
        Parameters:
        cList - - the List of all Coordinators running, or null if it's just one. very important -- if you pass a list here, LISA will System.exit(0) when the last test has ended!
        c - - the Coordinator that should run this test
        updateSecs - - how frequently you want stats output into the Stream (min of 1)
        statusOut - - the Stream object that should receive status output, or null
        mode - - the type (standalone or embedded) of execution this test should run under
        Returns:
        the exit status for the test, which is modeled after command line invokation. Constants are in com.itko.lisa.test.Environment. 0 (Zero) means success, non-zero is some kind of error condition.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestRunException
        See Also:
        Coordinator, Environment

      • runThisTest

        public static int runThisTest(java.util.List<?> cList,
              Coordinator c,
              int updateSecs,
              java.io.PrintStream statusOut,
              java.lang.String htmlReportPath,
              TestRunner.ExecutionMode mode)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              TestRunException
        This method simplifies exeuting a test case and receiving stats output through the given stream. If the test executes normally, every updateSecs interval there will be a logging style output of the current TestRunInfo stats.
        Parameters:
        cList - - the List of all Coordinators running, or null if it's just one. very important -- if you pass a list here, LISA will System.exit(0) when the last test has ended!
        c - - the Coordinator that should run this test
        updateSecs - - how frequently you want stats output into the Stream (min of 1)
        statusOut - - the Stream object that should receive status output, or null
        htmlReportPath - - the absolute path to output an HTML report to
        mode - - the type (standalone or embedded) of execution this test should run under
        Returns:
        the exit status for the test, which is modeled after command line invokation. Constants are in com.itko.lisa.test.Environment. 0 (Zero) means success, non-zero is some kind of error condition.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        TestRunException
        See Also:
        Coordinator, Environment

      • getAvailableResources

        public static java.util.List<com.itko.lisa.acl.standards.shared.IResource> getAvailableResources(com.itko.lisa.model.mar.ModelArchive mar,
                                                                                 com.itko.lisa.test.Project project,
                                                                                 com.itko.lisa.acl.standards.shared.IResource.ResourceTypes resourceType,
                                                                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> attrs)
                                                                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to get a list of resources available to the current user (when ACL is enabled) or defined through the RESOURCE_GROUP property in the active project configuration. If the passed-in project is null and there is no configuration specified in the mar info, we would figure out the configuration from the lisa.project by extracting the lisa.project file from the mar
        Parameters:
        mar -
        project -
        resourceType -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
